The bar area is a little dark, but then what bar isn't? Am I right? The seating was all High-tops or Bar stools (at least in the direction I was facing) so it may not be suitable for small children. On Friday's from 7pm to 11pm they have a different band playing from the advertisements I've seen on the walls.

I definitely need to go back here for the BBQ everyone raves about someday, but for now, I'll add them to my rotation of HH spots willingly.
Hailey is the best bartender ever, she's so cute and attenative. Thanks for making our visit memorable.
It's a click bar, if your a regular they treat you well, if you are not they do not give customer service.  The location on thunderbird welcomes all, 59th Not

We have been here a couple of times and always enjoy it.  
I've had the smoked turkey twice and love it! Moist, smokey and tender--just wished they had a  spicy cranberry chutney for it.  I like the homestyle mashed potatoes and white gravy and the bbq beans are great with the right amount of heat. The burnt ends are great, too. 

My husband had the pulled pork platter and rated it as excellent. 

We shared the salted caramel vanilla cake with a custard between layers and loved it. Sharing was the right choice as it is rich. 

Our server was smiling, friendly and attentive. Drinks were refilled regularly. And our food arrived quickly.   We'll be back.

Pretty basic - pork drenched in BBQ. The fries were raw, but I'm happy to see that Dillon's has passed the minimum wage increase in AZ to its customers. Check the bottom of the receipt if you wanna punish yourself and eat here, you'll see P206 2.2%. That is some shady business...

People usually comment about certain places saying they are going downhill as a negative review, I would say the same about Dillon's but that would imply they were on the hill to begin with. The food was terrible the service was terrible the environment is old and outdated and desperately needing a renovation. In the Phoenix metro area the restaurant business is extremely competitive and for this business to be stuck in time...it is a sign that they will not be around for long. If you want good barbecue try somewhere else.

Sauce variety is so so. Ribs are tiny, even for babybacks. Other meat accompaniments include brisket (too dry for me), pulled chicken, p[ulled pork, and smoked sausage. The waitress claimed they make the sausage on site but it tasted very generic, like it came out of a hillshire farms packet from costco. The steak fries were the only side I ate and they appeared to have some skin on them but still tasted so so. There is much better BBQ to be had in the NW Phoenix area.

Pulled pork sandwich was awesome, the sweet heat sauce was very good, staff was very friendly and helpful, only problem I seen was it was way too warm inside for being 105 outside... 

Prices were reasonable also.

I've been frequenting Dillon's for many years but it's been awhile since my last visit.
I remember they had the best onion rings. It had really thin and crunchy batter and came out really fresh. Today, I was little disappointed. It looks like they must've change the batter, much thicker and very doughy. I hope it was just an off day. We also ordered the salmon salad but came out really fishy and the salmon looked like it had some kind of coating on it. Maybe it was the cheese but didn't care for it. 
The catfish and mashed potatoes were the same as I remember it. They were very tasty. However, they must've changed their mac and cheese too. It was served with larger elbow pasta. 
The beef brisket quesadillas were really yummy. It had nice crunchy tortilla filled with lots of meat and cheese. 
Overall, service was excellent; however some of the dishes leaves a lot to be desired.

I really wanted to give this place a chance but it was extremely difficult when our server made us feel like we're an incovinience. She was in a horrible mood, was bossy, never smiled, talked to us like we were stupid and wasn't very attentive unless she absolutely needed to be. Maybe she was having an off day but c'mon girl, fake it till you make it. It was one of those experiences where you don't want to ask for anything additional cause you don't want to piss them off even more than they already are. Overall total buzz kill. Thanks for killin my vibe, Hailey.

What's really sad is I posted this same review on Facebook and they just deleted it instead of reaching out and trying to explain why this happened........
Total disappointment for Thanksgiving Day. We were all so excited to go to Dillon's for Thanksgiving and avoid the all day long cooking and cleanup associated with a holiday feast. A party of 9 of us showed up for our 2:30 reservation, seated rather quickly only to find out the the BBQ Beef Brisket Platter half of us were waiting to enjoy was shelved from the menu per our waitress. Evidently the turkey wasn't as big of a seller as thought so we were told the brisket wasn't being served and we had to chose between the turkey or ham steak. Yet as you walk in, the Thanksgiving feast sign was still on display showing the menu choices including the brisket. Total shock after you order drinks and appetizers then go to order your dinner and find out what most people in your party want,Isn't being served. Very unprofessional and false advertising. Dillon's was always one of my go to places to eat but I don't know if I will be going back again. Happy Thanksgiving from Dillon's!

Greeter was a very nice girl.

To go order girl was nice, but a little awkward.

Beef ribs were very tasty, but there wasn't as much meat on the bones as I am used to for beef ribs.  1 less start for volume of meat on bones.

Mashed potatoes and gravy was delicious.  

Stew soup was good as well.

This was my first time here. A deal was the reason I came.  I would go again.

THESE GUYS ARE THE BEST OF THE BEST!!! I visit Dillon's all the time, weekly for sure and sometime 2-3 times a week! Yes it's that great! 
You get delicious food, awesome service, reasonable prices and the Dillon's crew is oh so welcoming & friendly! 
I love you Rich, Heather & Joey!!! My favorite is the pulled pork sandwich & also the burnt ends with Cajun BBQ sauce, yummy! Plus they have nightly happy hour drink specials! Can't beat that, I've recommended this place to all my family & friends. They all love it too! Dillon's you rock! Thank you for coming to my neighborhood!
What's up with the chili?!? Using hamburger now?? Don't go cheap. Why would you change something so dramatic?

Our friend recommended the ribs, and after Yelping the area near her house, we could not come up with a better idea. Parking is at the back so you stroll around they ponds to the pretty front landscaped area which faces on to N 59th Ave, where a few hostesses are happily waiting to seat you. The place filled up quickly on a Thursday night. Dining tables are wrapped around the huge bar area, and there are lots of TV screens, but hey it is a sports bar. We were dressed to attend a classical concert, but nobody stared at us, and actually most people were dressed up although the decor is more down home casual to fit the tasty ribs slathered in BBQ sauce.
Since my husband ordered said ribs, Amber our friendly server, tied a bib on him that said "I love pig butts and I can not lie". He loved it and asked for an extra to take home. The ribs were delicious but what is listed as their hottest sauce tasted mild to his CA palette. On the other hand, I asked for the hottest sauce they had for my fish tacos (what is a nice pescatarian like me doing in a place like this? See above) and they delivered not only a nice salsa but a bowl of hot sauce that delivered a punch. 
I was happy with my three huge fish tacos plus a side of mashed potatoes and potato salad. You choose the sides from a list of about ten, and I like potatoes so what the heck. A Yelper recommended the potato salad, and it was very good. Fortunately Amber asked me which kind of gravy I wanted on my mashed potatoes, because I forgot that they do not mention the mashed potatoes automatically comes with gravy that I do not want, so I was able to stave off the gravy, and they remembered to exclude it on my order. 
We were rushed because we had to get to the concert, and our food order was late, so Amanda brought our bill early as we requested. I would eat here again, and give myself time to sip my sauvignon blanc and my husband could guzzle more of one of their many  beers on tap.
Amazing food, Amazing service, Amazing atmosphere!  Give them a try, you won't regret it!

So we have 3 younger kids. They gave each of our kids a tablet to play with before dinner with Disney and Dr. Seuss apps. I was shocked. I had the prime rib and it was outstanding. We love going here based on prices for our family of 6. Great desserts too.

Three in our party.  Very comfortable atmosphere. Courtney was our server. She was very kind went through menu with us. Made great recommendations. Two of us had pick two meats platter. Burnt ends and baby back ribs, mashed potatoes Mac n cheese and coke slaw. All excellent. Husband had hot beef on a French toast topped with large helping of mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese. Loved it too. This is going to be our new dinner place. Highly recommend.
